p: Table 7 shows a negative correlation between the respective phenolic, proanthocyanidin, flavonoid constituents, and the IC 50 DPPH antioxidant capacity in M. sinensis flesh ( r = −0.999; −0.938 and −0.998), M. sinensis peel ( r = −0.123; −0.708 and −0.664), and M. paradisiaca flesh ( r = −0.947; −0.998 and −0.979), while the IC 50 DPPH antioxidant capacity of M. paradisiaca peel positively correlated with the proanthocyanidin ( r = 0.43) and flavonoid ( r = 0.323) constituents.
